title: Ticket #6177: Removing items while iterating HashTable can fail
description:
Tracking down the segfault in DAGMan (#6170). Turns out the problem is this: if you're iterating through a HashTable, and removing each object as you go, the interaction between remove() and iterate() is not correct. If multiple keys in the HashTable hash to an index of 0, you only see one of those items; when you remove it from the HashTable, iterate() skips over all other items that hash to index 0.

The problematic code is this: 

  // if the item being deleted is being iterated, ensure that
  // next iteration returns the object "after" this one
  if (bucket == currentItem)
  {
      currentItem = 0;
      if (--currentBucket < 0) currentBucket = 0;
  }

It turns out that we need to allow currentBucket to be set back to -1...

I'm currently testing a fix for this...

2017-Mar-16 16:33:29 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW The code is correct, with the caveat that 0 is a legal, in-use value for currentBucket, and -1 means there's no currentBucket. Can we change the code from 

if (--currentBucket < -1) currentBucket = -1;

to 

if (--currentBucket < 0) currentBucket = -1

It does the same thing, but I think it is clearer.

otherwise, go ahead and merge.
